title: Motherwell's League Cup permutations explained
title_page: Motherwell's League Cup permutations explained - BBC Sport
maintext:
Alasdair Lamont, BBC Scotland
Group G
Anything other than a Motherwell defeat at home to East Fife will mean Stuart Kettlewellâ€™s side finish top.
But the Fifers know a win would take them above Well and into first.
A bonus point win would leave them second behind their hosts on goal difference and although they would have nine points, a goal difference of plus two seems unlikely to be enough to progress.
